body.p:
Williamstown
Dec 1 -- 1863
Hon Thos E Brambet
Gover. of Kentucky
Dear Sir

Enclosed is the petition of John Marques of this county which explains itself. I will add that the facts are I believe correctly stated, but no Do fully as they might have been John Neal is his son in law, lived near the time between Scalt & Grant. There was a great nest of theives in his neighborhood that annoyd the people greatly. Neal was accused of being one of the theives -- was tried with a number of others & held to bail by a court of inquiry -- Marques was his bail.

After the trial a company of citizens mostly Home guards & mostly good citizens held a meeting & resolved that John Neal should leave ^the^ neighborhood together with his brother Thomas Neal & others or they would hang them. Neal was notified & left & has never returned -- now as I am informed lives out of the state -- I believe in Ia. The others left also -- The stealing had no connection with the rebelion the Neals being loyal Union men & prosecuted in partly the best Union men in the county. Neal is a bad man but is fair. I was prosecuting him & know what I write is true -- Marques gets drunk -- but is an industrious peaceable old man -- is loyal -- owns 200 acres of poor bushy hill land & nothing now
has a host of grandchildren to support -- the family of one son who has been in the Federal army since 1861 being of the number. He is truly & actively loyal & c & except his dispotition is a harmless citizen -- is old & infirm & will be ruined -- utterly ruined -- if he has this Jugt to pay. I therefor earnestly write in asking that you remit it all except officers fees &c If desired he will try to get Neal & have him tried although he is his son in law.
His land is to be sold on the 14th inst. Mr Scott is the comwlths atty
